title: Rob Roy Way Walking Route

images.title: Ian Cleland / Lochan Allt a' Chip Dhuibh
images.caption: Lochan Allt a' Chip Dhuibh. On the Rob Roy Way from Aberfoyle. The notice reads "Stank - No Fishing "

images.title: Lis Burke / View towards Aberfeldy
images.caption: View towards Aberfeldy. Looking down towards Aberfeldy from the Way above the Tay valley.

images.title: Ian Cleland / Stile on the Rob Roy Way
images.caption: Stile on the Rob Roy Way near Inchmahome Priory, Loch Venachar and Loch Drunkie in the Loch Lomond and the Trossachs National Park.

images.title: Trish Steel, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Garrow, Glen Quaich. The River Quaich is crossed by a narrow bridge at this point. The track takes you to Tirchardie and is part of the Rob Roy Way.

images.title: A827 crosses the Rob Roy Way by Rob Burke, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: A827 crosses the Way at Grandtully.

images.title: Lis Burke / Track through trees
images.caption: Track through trees. This track through woodland above the Tay valley forms part of the Way.

images.title: Ray Woodcraft / Tributary burn of Allt Meall nan Damh
images.caption: Tributary burn of Allt Meall nan Damh. Near the Way south of Ardeonaig.

images.title: Jonathan Billinger / Rob Roy Way
images.caption: The Long Distance Footpath follows this road for part of the way from Glen Quaich to Kenmore. The mountains in the distance are the group north of Glen Lyon including Schiehallion to the right of centre.

description: Follow in the footsteps of Robert Roy MacGregor, famous Scottish folk hero and outlaw of the early 18th century. The walk takes you across the Southern Highland of Scotland taking in some of the most beautiful countryside in the UK. Starting from Drymen on the West Highland Way it goes north east to finish in Pitlochry. The path passes a series of beautiful Lochs including Loch Venachar, Loch Tay and Loch Earn. You will also pass a series of spectacular waterfalls such as the Falls of Dochart and The Falls of Moness. There is also a waterside section along the River Tay with the Cairngorm mountains making a splendid backdrop.
display_address: Old Gartmore Road, Drymen, Stirling, Alba / Scotland, G63 0BH, United Kingdom
